title: Art. 73 AI Act - Reporting of serious incidents - AI Act
text:
```markdown
# Art. 73 AI Act - Reporting of serious incidents

1. Providers of high-risk AI systems placed on the Union market shall report any serious incident to the market surveillance authorities of the Member States where that incident occurred.
2. The report referred to in paragraph 1 shall be made immediately after the provider has established a causal link between the AI system and the serious incident or the reasonable likelihood of such a link, and, in any event, not later than 15 days after the provider or, where applicable, the deployer, becomes aware of the serious incident.
   - The period for the reporting referred to in the first subparagraph shall take account of the severity of the serious incident.
3. Notwithstanding paragraph 2 of this Article, in the event of a widespread infringement or a serious incident as defined in [Article 3, point (49)(b)](https://ai-act-law.eu/article/3/), the report referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article shall be provided immediately, and not later than two days after the provider or, where applicable, the deployer becomes aware of that incident.
4. Notwithstanding paragraph 2, in the event of the death of a person, the report shall be provided immediately after the provider or the deployer has established, or as soon as it suspects, a causal relationship between the high-risk AI system and the serious incident, but not later than 10 days after the date on which the provider or, where applicable, the deployer becomes aware of the serious incident.
5. Where necessary to ensure timely reporting, the provider or, where applicable, the deployer, may submit an initial report that is incomplete, followed by a complete report.
6. Following the reporting of a serious incident pursuant to paragraph 1, the provider shall, without delay, perform the necessary investigations in relation to the serious incident and the AI system concerned.
   - This shall include a risk assessment of the incident and corrective action.
   - The provider shall cooperate with:
     - The competent authorities,
     - And where relevant with:
       - The notified body concerned,
     during these investigations.
   - The provider shall not perform any investigation which involves altering an AI system concerned in a way which may affect any subsequent evaluation of causes of an incident prior to informing competent authorities about such action.
7. Upon receiving a notification related to a serious incident referred to in [Article 3](https://ai-act-law.eu/article/3/) point (49)(c), **the relevant market surveillance authority** shall inform **the national public authorities or bodies** referred to in [Article 77(1)](https://ai-act-law.eu/article/77/). **The Commission** shall develop dedicated guidance to facilitate compliance with obligations set out in paragraph 1 of this Article. **That guidance** shall be issued by **2 August 2025**, and shall be assessed regularly.
8. The market surveillance authority shall take appropriate measures as provided for in [Article 19](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/HTML/?uri=CELEX:32019R1020#d1e2031-1-1) within seven days from when it received a notification referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article and shall follow notification procedures as provided for under that Regulation.
9. For high-risk AI systems referred to in [Annex III](https://ai-act-law.eu/annex/iii/) that are placed on market or put into service by providers subject to Union legislative instruments laying down reporting obligations equivalent to those set out in this Regulation:
   - The notification of serious incidents shall be limited to those referred to in [Article 3](https://ai-act-law.eu/article/3/) point (49)(c).
   - For high-risk AI systems which are safety components of devices or are themselves devices covered by Regulations (EU) 2017/745 and (EU) 2017/746:
     - Notification of serious incidents shall be limited to those referred to in [Article 3](https://ai-act-law.eu/article/3/) point (49)(c) and must be made directly to national competent authorities chosen by Member States where incidents occur.

[AI Act Table Of Contents](https://ai-act-law.eu)
```
